subject: Re: [junit] @AfterClass is poorly defined
msgSnippet: ... Stuff that you put in the constructor gets executed for every test method in your class. So, it s much more like @Before than like @BeforeClass. Take care,
messageBody:
2009/3/3 kot_10_4 <kot_10_4@...>:
> It would be way more useful if this annotation could be applied to a
> non-static method. The same could be said for @BeforeClass but at
> least you can put code you would have put in @BeforeClass in the
> constructor.

Stuff that you put in the constructor gets executed for every test
method in your class. So, it's much more like @Before than like
@BeforeClass.

Take care, Ilja
